did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Miles Galvin Manuscript on a Comparative Analysis of Labor Movements, 1984- 1988
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Miles Galvin Manuscript on a Comparative Analysis of Labor Movements #6372. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Chapter 3 (Old): The Contrasting Ideologies of Labor Movements
Chapter 4: Labor Movements With the Ideology of Revolutionary Class Confrontation, Focus on France
Chapter 6: Labor Movements With the Ideology of Nationalist Class Collaboration, Focus on Mexico
Chapter 7: The Problem of Job Security and the Swedish Labor Movement's Efforts to do Something About It
Chapter 8: Income Insecurity, Declining Productivity, and What's Happening in Japan
Chapter 9: Working Conditions and the Struggle for Worker Self-Management, Focus on Israel, Spain, Yugoslavia, Norway
Chapter 10: The Struggle of Black Workers in Racist South Africa, A Cutting Edge in the Fight for Worker Liberation in the First World
Chapter 11: Solidarity's Struggle in Communist Poland, A Second-World Cutting Edge in the Fight for Worker Liberation
